overview: From 2025-05-25 to 2025-06-01, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (1 merged), 3 new issues, and 10 active contributors.

topIssues.title: LOG_LEVEL not working
topIssues.author: standujar
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

The LOG_LEVEL variable is not working anymore. I have the same log level if I se LOG_LEVEL=debug ou DEBUG or INFO or info.

topPRs.title: feat: Add Project TEE Starter Template
topPRs.author: HashWarlock
topPRs.body:
<!-- Use this template by filling in information and copying and pasting relevant items out of the HTML comments. -->

# Relates to
Adds TEE Project Starter Template for a quickstart to launch in TEE Cloud provider. For the time being, Phala Cloud is the current available option for a customizable ElizaOS deployment.
<!-- LINK TO ISSUE OR TICKET -->

<!-- This risks section must be filled out before the final review and merge. -->

# Risks
Low
<!--
Low, medium, large. List what kind of risks and what could be affected.
-->

# Background

## What does this PR do?
Creates a quick start to generate a TEE Agent project.
## What kind of change is this?
Feature
<!--
Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)
Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
Updates (new versions of included code)
-->

<!-- This "Why" section is most relevant if there are no linked issues explaining why. If there is a related issue, it might make sense to skip this why section. -->
<!--
## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?
-->

# Documentation changes needed?

<!--
My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.
My changes require a change to the project documentation.
If documentation change is needed: I have updated the documentation accordingly.
-->

<!-- Please show how you tested the PR. This will really help if the PR needs to be retested and probably help the PR get merged quicker. -->

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?
A reviewer should start with getting a Phala Cloud Account to test the CVM deployment. Get an API Key and Install the Phala Cloud CLI for deployment. Check Docs [here]()
### Detailed testing steps
First clone the repo (I have not added the CLI command, yet. This could be easier with elizaos CLI.)
```bash
# Make sure you are in the `project-tee-starter` folder
npm install -g phala
# Set TEE_MODE=PRODUCTION
# Ensure you are also running docker

# Step0: Set your API Key from Phala Cloud Dashboard
phala auth login

# Step1: Build Docker Image
phala docker build

# Step2: Publish Docker Image to DockerHub
phala docker push

# Step3: Update docker-compose.yaml file with your published Docker image and deploy CVM
phala cvms create -c docker-compose.yaml -e .env

# (Optional) Step4: Check attestation
phala cvms attestation

# (Optional) Step5: Upgrade CVM if updated changes
phala cvms upgrade -c docker-compose.yaml
```
<!--
None: Automated tests are acceptable.
-->

<!--
- As [anon/admin], go to [link]

  - verify [result]
-->

topPRs.title: feat: Migrate knowledge tab to plugin-knowledge, add graph view to memories
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR makes some changes to enable the knowledge plugin

- Some stuff could be moved out of the PR but is probably fine, like the package.json changes, and we should adopt the convention of .beta" anyways

- Removes knowledge APIs since they are in plugin-knowledge

- Adds some PCA stuff to map embeddings to a 2D graph

- Adds a graph view to memories and lib stuff for other views

topPRs.title: feat: describe images WIP
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
Draft describing works only for small images. 

Not complete. 

We would need to do cleanup for the prompt. Right now url is being added in the prompt.

ig we need to test this a bit and see what's best approach for image description from the client side.

topPRs.title: feat: Add graph view for memories and knowledge
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- expose embeddings via API with `includeEmbedding` flag
- add PCA implementation and simple force graph
- integrate graph toggle for memory and knowledge views
- add unit test for PCA

## Testing
- `bun test` *(fails: vi.resetAllMocks is not a function)*
